intro: Hieracium acidolepis, commonly known as the acid-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring moist and well-drained conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive sour or acidic scent when crushed. Hieracium acidolepis produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and it is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
